Human schistosomiasis is caused by Schistosoma mansoni that uses molluscs of genus Biomphalaria as its intermediate host. In many cases, prevention methods like Biomphalaria and Oncomelania eradication using chemical pesticides are relevant to control the disease. Niclosamide (Bayluscide, Bayer, Leverkusen, Germany) is the only commercially available molluscicide recommended by the World Health Organization (WHO) for large-scale use in Schistosomiasis Control Programs.
3 However, this drug is toxic to other organisms, and resistance to niclosamide requires a search for new drugs and substances to be used in the vector control.
4 Therefore, the WHO encourages a search for alternative drugs in schistosomiasis control. Natural products can be seen as a promising alternative as they are plentiful in schistosomiasis-endemic countries and have a large number of different substances in their extracts, which hinders the appearance of vectors-resistance.
